Madame C.J. Walker

Legendary Business Woman and Millionaire

Here's a time line of Dr. Madame C.J. Walker's Life

  • Born Sarah Breedlove on December 23rd, 1867 on a cotton plantation.
  • Got married to Moses McWilliams at the age of 14 and gave birth to A'leila on June 6, 1885.
  • In the early 1890s, she developed a scalp condition that caused her to lose much of her hair. This inspired her to begin experimenting with different haif products and indredients to find a remedy for her hair troubles.
  • In 1905, Annie Malone hired Sarah as a sales agent to sell hair care products.
  • In 1908, Madame Walker opened a beauty school and factory in Pittsburgh.
  • In 1918, Madame C.J. Walker built a mansion that she named Villa Lewaro.
  • Walker died in 1919 due to hypertension and funeral services were held at Villa Lewaro.

Madame Walker was a business woman and philanthropist.

Don't sit down and wait for opportunities to come. Get up and make them."

- Madame C.J. Walker Read more about the incredible accomplishments of Madame Walker Here.
